metadata.Description: The ability of an energy system to withstand and recover from disruptions, such as natural disasters or cyber attacks, and continue to provide reliable and sustainable energy services.

level 1.Description: Energy resilience addresses the challenges posed by climate change impacts to ensure a reliable and sustainable energy supply.
Energy resilience employs microgrid systems to enhance the resilience and reliability of energy infrastructure.
Energy resilience collaborates with disaster management agencies to develop strategies for energy supply during emergencies and natural disasters.
Energy resilience supports the integration of renewable energy sources into the energy system to enhance resilience and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.
Energy resilience administers grants to support projects and initiatives that enhance energy resilience in vulnerable communities.
Energy resilience measures the level of energy security to identify vulnerabilities and develop strategies for improvement.
Energy resilience aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals, particularly Goal 7 on affordable and clean energy for all.
Energy resilience is an instance of resilient energy systems that are designed to withstand disruptions and ensure continuous energy supply.
